page.title: 13Landscape
page.content: The area is of pleasing appearance with many trees and hedges but only a few elm tillers remain. Villages have grown in size but it in with landscape as new homeowners quickly create attractive gardens. Church buildings are in good condition. They and public houses are used as reference points for travellers. Only two pubs in the area: 'The Falcon' 20/46 and the old 'The Admiral' Head' 22/47 recetly attractively renovated. Buildings are brick-built, mainly red, although some larger 19th century houses are of Suffolk Whites; a few cottages with flint walls. Playford hall in Fynn Valley is hidden from north and south areas by land profile and trees. Wooded area 22/46, 23/46 is comprised of deciduous trees, privately owned. Low summer rainfall prevents vivid colouring in autumn.
